alert.note: Alert for Jefferson (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 07 at 7:52AM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CDT THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...At least minor flooding is expected to occur. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Nebraska, including the following county, Jefferson. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding is still expected in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 752 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated that the heavy rain had ended. Some flash flooding likely occurred earlier as some culverts were reported to be washed out. Some flooding is still expected due to the earlier heavy rain. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Fairbury, Plymouth, Endicott, Jansen, Reynolds, Harbine, Crystal Springs Campground, Camp Jefferson, Rock Creek Station State Historical Park, Cub Creek Recreational Area, Gladstone and Buckley Creek Recreational Area.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive into flooded areas, the road surface may be washed out.
